Despite dropping this damn game on its face for about three years, I'm glad to come back to it. I've heard about the qualms of some of the updates during that time, and I do wish Valve gave it a little bit more love. Nonetheless, coming back to TF2 is something I can never regret. 
[strike]I'm a pubbie, very new to the new matchmaking/casual mode, scared sh*tless to try competitive. 
Sure, I'm not fond of the skinned weapons, the TF economy is absolutely absurd, but as an uber-casual pubbie those don't really matter to me.[/strike]
2018 update: I'm genuinely considering going competitive. And I've fallen in love with War Paints. I have a scattergun collection now.

I'm just here to kick some *ss, blow people up, and have a good time.

JUNGLE INFERNO/SCREAM FORTRESS IX UPDATE: It's good. Some contracts are ridiculous. At least we now have jetpack pyros with an *ss-blasting taunt. And a banana.
Literally: "The most fun you can have online, for free"

Besides the rise of the Bot era In tf2, Its still on of  my number 1 childhood games. I had fun, made some good memories and one time even, I considered to be my main game for my intire life. Things do change...the overall support of valve right now and overall community got me burned out. Dont get me wrong, I love the community, but they do seem to have the urge push there limits to much. Like as soon as someone mentions tf2 like a famous influencer,streamer,content creator, etc... They community tends to push even further of just getting attention, like for example: some fans of the game will start spamming In comment section or anywhere else they can make contact with that person to play this game, that would just make a person who mentioned the game feel mad or start ignoring the game. 
I like the support this community gives to this game, but overall, the main breaking point for me was the community. Im as heart broken as you guys about the state of the game, but...no all things last forever... I know that, since for me myself I went threw a lot since I stopped playing the game. A huge heart for this game/10 thanks for the fun you gave me.

I came here from youtube, and I immediately fell in love with the cartoony style, and the excessive violence, with which you are able to completely annihilate your enemies (You ever wanted to kill someone who has 1 hp with a hellstorm of critical hits?). 
Overall, I would only have 1 thing to complain about, and that is that the fish AI sucks
